intro: Noticastrum eriophorum, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbel flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a hairy surface that helps reduce water loss. Noticastrum eriophorum is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
